title: Intro to the Sonnet
preview: Traces the origins and structure of the sonnet, distinguishing between Italian (Petrarchan) and English (Shakespearean) forms, and their enduring emotional intensity.

title: Intro to the Villanelle
preview: Explores the circular, obsessive qualities of the villanelle, a 19-line form known for its refrains and haunting psychological effect.

title: Intro to the Sestina
preview: Breaks down the complex structure of the sestina, a spiraling form built on lexical repetition and medieval constraint-based composition.

title: Intro to the Ghazal
preview: Introduces the ghazal, a lyrical form with roots in Arabic and Persian verse, emphasizing longing, spiritual love, and rhymed couplets.

title: Intro to the Haibun
preview: Examines the haibun, a Japanese poetic form combining prose and haiku, traditionally used for travel narratives and reflective memoir.
